insult: Your code is like Internet Explorer — nobody wants to work with it.
You're the kind of dev who writes CSS with `!important` on every line.
Even AI can’t explain your code — and I asked twice.
Your logic is so broken, even null ran away.
You make Java look fast.
Your Git history looks like a horror story — full of force-pushes and regrets.
You must code in production… because nothing makes sense and everything’s on fire.
Your `console.log` is your debugger… and your therapist.
You refactor like a cat on the keyboard — randomly and with chaos.
Your pull requests come with popcorn — because they’re always dramatic.
Your code needs a README, a TED Talk, and divine intervention.
You write `if (true)` just to feel safe.
Your Stack Overflow history deserves its own Netflix documentary.
You use inline styles like it's 1999.
Your app crashes more than my sleep schedule.
You commit `.env` files like it's a feature.
You think ‘clean code’ means deleting someone else’s work.
Your functions are so long, they need an intermission.
Your merge conflicts have merge conflicts.
You use ‘admin123’ as the default password — and call it secure.
Your idea of code reuse is copy-pasting Stack Overflow answers — without reading them.
Your CSS is so broken, even Bootstrap gave up on you.
You test in production like it’s a religion.
Your code smells worse than a 10-year-old PHP project.
You use comments to apologize instead of explain.
Your UI looks like it was designed by throwing pixels at the screen.
You write unit tests that always pass — even if nothing works.
You use `console.log('here')` more than you write actual logic.
Your code review comments are just 'LGTM' — because even you gave up.
You deploy on Friday… and expect a peaceful weekend.
